name: St. Blandina
summary: Blandina was a Christian slave who was martyred in Lyons in 177 during the persecution of Marcus Aurelius. According to the account preserved by Eusebius, she was a young slave woman who, despite being tortured repeatedly, remained steadfast in her faith. She was finally killed in the arena, tied to a stake and exposed to wild beasts. Her courage and endurance inspired many, and she became one of the most celebrated martyrs of the early Church.
